Silence is a Spell in Baldur's Gate 3. Silence is a Lvl 2 Spell from the Illusion school. Spells can be used for dealing damage to Enemies, inflict Status Ailments, buff Characters or interact with the environment.

BG3 Silence Information

Description: Create a sound-proof sphere. All within are Silenced and Immune to Thunder damage. Using this spell might turn targets hostile. Level: Lvl 2 Spell School: Illusion School Casting Time: Action Duration: 100 turns Range: 18m Radius: 6m Requires Concentration: Yes Saving Throw: None

How to Acquire Silence in Baldur's Gate 3

Silence can be acquired by the following classes: Bard, Cleric, Ranger, Oath of Devotion, Circle of the Land, Way of Shadow Silence can be cast by using the following Items: ???

Bard, Cleric, Ranger, Oath of Devotion, Circle of the Land, Way of Shadow

Silence Tips & Notes in BG3

Silence is a ritual spell which can be cast without expending a spell slot outside combat. Useful outside of combat to silence an alarm or counter Harpy charm song, or to silence actions that make noise that might draw unwanted attention, eg. breaking a door or wall, or killing sleeping enemies without waking others. Particularly useful against enemy spellcasters.
